title: Speaker Kevin McCarthy says he won't support Santos' re-election bid after indictment
description: Santos surrenders to face fraud, money laundering and theft of public funds charges

title: Google launches new AI tools
description: As the race to dominate artificial intelligence escalates between tech giants, Google unveiled new AI software to build presentations, analyze and enter data, and write content. NBC News’ Jacob Ward has more details on growing concerns over the future of AI.

title: Google is giving its dominant search engine an artificial-intelligence makeover
description: Google on Wednesday disclosed plans to infuse its dominant search engine with more advanced artificial-intelligence technology.

title: New arrivals in El Paso weigh agonizing choices as Title 42 expiration deadline looms
description: In El Paso, officials urge migrants who crossed the border illegally to turn themselves in as the city braced to help many ahead of the end of Title 42.

title: Hulu content to be added to Disney+ for 'one-app experience,' CEO Bob Iger says
description: Disney plans to add Hulu content to Disney+, the company's marquee streaming platform.

title: Utah mom accused of killing husband with fentanyl in drink tried to poison him multiple times before, family says
description: Relatives of a Utah man who died in 2022 after his wife allegedly poisoned him had suspected her involvement, according to court records.

title: Heather Armstrong, founder of mommy blog Dooce, dies at 47
description: Heather Armstrong, founder of one of the first mommy blogs, Dooce.com, has died, according to an Instagram post on her account.

title: Sen. Dianne Feinstein returns to Washington and plans to work a 'lighter schedule'
description: Sen. Dianne Feinstein, D-Calif., arrived back at Capitol Hill on Wednesday afternoon following a nearly three-month absence due to health issues.

title: FDA advisory panels back making Opill birth control pill available over-the-counter
description: An FDA panel voted to recommend approval of Opill birth control pill for over-the-counter use. The oral contraceptive was FDA approved as a prescription in 1973.

title: Trump's sexual abuse verdict won't hurt his 2024 primary chances, friends and foes say
description: Many of Donald Trump's friends and foes in the GOP say smart money is on the former president escaping unharmed within the GOP after the sexual abuse verdict.

title: Paramount brands to lay off 25% of U.S. staff as MTV News shuts down
description: Layoffs will be hitting 25% of employees across the Showtime, MTV Entertainment Studios and Paramount Media Networks groups in the U.S.

title: Scientists announce rough draft of human pangenome
description: Researchers have constructed a rough draft of a human pangenome, a collection of DNA that represents the genetic information from 47 individuals.

title: House lawmakers to host bipartisan dinner with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman
description: House Democrats and Republicans will hold a dinner at the Capitol next week with Sam Altman, the CEO of OpenAI, developer of ChatGPT.

title: Biden admin plans to order release of migrants into U.S. with no way to track them
description: After more than 11,000 migrants crossed the southern border on Tuesday, the Biden administration is now preparing a memo that will direct Customs and Border Protection to begin releasing migrants into the United States without court dates or the ability to track them.

title: Hackers to test limits of AI technology at Las Vegas event
description: OpenAI and other major AI providers are coordinating with the Biden administration to let thousands of hackers take a shot at testing the limits of their technology.

title: George Santos surrenders to federal law enforcement to face fraud, money laundering and additional charges
description: Rep. George Santo was taken into custody at a Long Island courthouse as the Department of Justice unsealed a 13-count federal indictment against him.

title: Consumer price growth falls to below 5% for the first time in two years
description: Consumer prices climbed 4.9% in April — the first time annual inflation has fallen below 5% in two years.

title: As a monster tornado bore down, many in the Mississippi Delta had no chance of finding a shelter
description: After a deadly tornado hit Rolling Fork, Mississippi, NBC News found that there were no public storm shelters nearby. Many Delta communities can’t afford one.

title: A look at NASA’s new mission to explore the Earth’s oceans
description: Scientists at NASA are on a mission to study the surface of the Earth's oceans to observe how eddies, whirlpools and currents interact with the atmosphere and shape the Earth’s climate. NBC’s Jacob Soboroff reports for TODAY.

title: E. Jean Carroll says she's 'overwhelmed with joy' for women across the U.S. after Trump verdict
description: E. Jean Carroll said Wednesday she was "overwhelmed with joy" for women across America after former President Donald Trump was found liable for sexually abusing and defaming her.

title: Mike Pence navigates anger from all sides as he inches toward a presidential run
description: Mike Pence, who is slowly taking steps toward a presidential bid, appears to be undeterred by the vitriol — or by polls that consistently show him trailing in the primary.

title: Buddy Holly, the petit basset griffon Vendéen, wins Westminster dog show
description: This Buddy Holly no longer has to sigh, “That’ll be the day.”

title: Senate Republicans suggest Carroll verdict could imperil Trump's 2024 chances
description: Several Republican senators warned that the verdict against Donald Trump in the E. Jean Carroll case could pose significant challenges for him in 2024.

title: Tory Lanez denied new trial in Megan Thee Stallion shooting
description: A judge denied a motion for a new trial from lawyers for rapper Tory Lanez, convicted for shooting Megan Thee Stallion in the feet and wounding her.
